questions.question:
What is the result of the following expression in JavaScript?
10 + "20"
Which function is used to parse a string to an integer in JavaScript?
questions.answer: parseInt()

questions.question:
What will the following JavaScript code output?
console.log(0.1 + 0.2 === 0.3);
questions.answer: false

questions.question: In JavaScript, what is the purpose of the JSON.parse() function?
options: To convert a JSON string to a JavaScript object
To convert a JavaScript object to a JSON string
To parse a string to an integer
To parse a string to a float
questions.answer: To convert a JSON string to a JavaScript object

questions.question: How do you write a comment in JavaScript?
questions.answer: // This is a comment

questions.question: Which operator is used for concatenating strings in JavaScript?
What is the correct way to check if a variable is null in JavaScript?
questions.answer: if (myVar === null)

questions.question:
What is the output of the following code?
console.log(typeof null);
questions.answer: object

questions.question: What is the correct way to create a JavaScript array?
questions.answer: var arr = []

questions.question: What does the 'typeof' operator in JavaScript return for an array?
questions.answer: object

questions.question:
What is the output of the following code?
console.log(1 + '1' - 1);
What is the purpose of the 'return' statement in a JavaScript function?
options: To specify the output of the function
To end the function and return a value
questions.answer: To end the function and return a value

questions.question: Which built-in method is used to convert a string to lowercase in JavaScript?
questions.answer: toLowerCase()

questions.question: In JavaScript, what is the purpose of the 'addEventListener' method?
options: To attach an event handler to an element
To remove an event handler from an element
questions.answer: To attach an event handler to an element

questions.question: Which keyword is used to declare a block of code to be executed, based on a condition, in JavaScript?
questions.answer: if

questions.question: What is the correct way to loop through an array in JavaScript?
questions.answer: for (var i = 0; i < arr.length; i++)

questions.question:
What is the result of the following expression in JavaScript?
null + undefined
questions.answer: NaN

questions.question: What does the 'NaN' stand for in JavaScript?
questions.answer: Not a Number

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'slice' method in JavaScript?
options: To extract a portion of an array into a new array
questions.answer: To extract a portion of an array into a new array

questions.question: What is the correct way to compare two values for equality in JavaScript?
What is the correct way to access the last element of an array in JavaScript?
questions.answer: arr[arr.length - 1]

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'push' method in JavaScript?
options: To add an element to the end of an array
To remove the last element of an array
questions.answer: To add an element to the end of an array

questions.question: Which built-in method is used to join the elements of an array into a string in JavaScript?
questions.answer: join()

questions.question:
What is the result of the following expression in JavaScript?
10 - '5'

options: To remove the last element of an array
To add an element to the end of an array
questions.answer: To remove the last element of an array

questions.question: What does the 'splice' method do in JavaScript?
options: Adds or removes elements from an array
Sorts the elements of an array
Reverses the elements of an array
questions.answer: Adds or removes elements from an array

questions.question: In JavaScript, what is the purpose of the 'filter' method?
options: To create a new array with all elements that pass a test
To sort the elements of an array
To reverse the elements of an array
To add an element to the end of an array
questions.answer: To create a new array with all elements that pass a test

questions.question:
What is the result of the following expression in JavaScript?
'hello'.toUpperCase()
questions.answer: 'HELLO'

questions.question: In JavaScript, what is the purpose of the 'map' method?
options: To create a new array with the results of calling a function on every element
To sort the elements of an array
To reverse the elements of an array
To add an element to the end of an array
questions.answer: To create a new array with the results of calling a function on every element

questions.question: What is the correct way to remove the first element from an array in JavaScript?
questions.answer: arr.shift()

What is the result of the following expression in JavaScript?
Math.max(5, 10, 3)

options: To reduce the array to a single value
To sort the elements of an array
To reverse the elements of an array
To add an element to the end of an array
questions.answer: To reduce the array to a single value

questions.question: What does the 'localStorage' object in JavaScript allow you to do?
options: Store key-value pairs in a web browser
questions.answer: Store key-value pairs in a web browser

options: To return the first element that passes a test
To sort the elements of an array
To reverse the elements of an array
To add an element to the end of an array
questions.answer: To return the first element that passes a test

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'sort' method in JavaScript?
options: To sort the elements of an array
To add an element to the end of an array
To remove the last element of an array
To join the elements of an array into a string
questions.answer: To sort the elements of an array

typeof NaN
questions.answer: number

options: To add an element to the beginning of an array
To remove the last element of an array

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'reverse' method in JavaScript?
options: To reverse the order of the elements in an array
To add an element to the end of an array
To remove the last element of an array

options: To return the character at a specified index in a string
To sort the characters of a string
To reverse the characters of a string
To add a character to a string

options: To replace a specified value with another value in a string
